titleInfo.title: (PC) Moreno v. Medina et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER and FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 11/12/08 ORDERING that Plaintiff's 2 Request to proceed IFP is GRANTED. Plaintiff must pay the statutory filing fee of $350 for this action. Payments shall be collected and paid in accordance with the order filed concurrently herewith. Claims against defendants Simmerson and Cochran are dismissed with leave to amend. Plaintiff has 30 days from the date of this to amend his complaint. Clerk is ordered to supply plaintiff with a blank summons, a copy of the 6/13/08 pleadings and four USM-285 forms for service on Medina, James, Waterman & Hitchcock. Further, it is RECOMMENDED that claims against HDSP be dismissed on the ground that plaintiff cannot state any claim against it. Objections to F&R's due within 20 days. (Streeter, J)

titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 1/28/2009 DIRECTING USM to serve on dfts David Medina, Rita Waterman, James, and Hitchcock. titleInfo.title: (PC) Moreno v. Medina et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 08/23/11 ordering within 14 days of the date of this order, defendants shall respond to plaintiff's allegations that his law library does not contain adequate legal materials. Plaintiff is granted 30 days from the date of this order to file an amended opposition to defendants' motion for summary judgment, if he chooses. Defendants' reply brief is due 21 days after plaintiff files his amended brief or his time for doing so expires, whichever is sooner. Plaintiff's 08/08/11 motion for appointment of counsel 94 is denied. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Moreno v. Medina et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 8/9/12 ORDERING 99 Findings and Recommendations are vacated; 49 Motion for Summary Judgment is denied without prejudice; Within 30 days of the date of this order, defendants may re-file and re-serve their motion for summary judgment; If defendants re-serve their motion, plaintiff may thereafter file and serve an amended or supplemental opposition within thirty days. If plaintiff fails to file an amended or supplemental opposition, the court will consider his existing opposition in resolving defendants' motion; If plaintiff files an amended or supplemental opposition, defendants may thereafter file an amended reply within fourteen days; 101 Motion for Extension of Time to object is denied as moot; and Plaintiff's motion for an order granting him PLU status 102 and his motion for an order compelling R.J. Donovan State Prison to ship him his property 103 are denied without prejudice.(Matson, R)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:08-cv-01344; (PC) Moreno v. Medina et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 8/9/12 ORDERING 99 Findings and Recommendations are vacated; 49 Motion for Summary Judgment is denied without prejudice; Within 30 days of the date of this order, defendants may re-file and re-serve their motion for summary judgment; If defendants re-serve their motion, plaintiff may thereafter file and serve an amended or supplemental opposition within thirty days. If plaintiff fails to file an amended or supplemental opposition, the court will consider his existing opposition in resolving defendants' motion; If plaintiff files an amended or supplemental opposition, defendants may thereafter file an amended reply within fourteen days; 101 Motion for Extension of Time to object is denied as moot; and Plaintiff's motion for an order granting him PLU status 102 and his motion for an order compelling R.J. Donovan State Prison to ship him his property 103 are denied without prejudice.(Matson, R)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Moreno v. Medina et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 2/14/14 ORDERING that A hearing on the motion is set for Wednesday, March 19, 2014 at 11:00 a.m., at the United States District Court, 501 I Street, Sacramento, California, in Courtroom No. 8, before the undersigned. Plaintiff shall appear at the hearing via videoconference from his current institution of confinement.(Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Moreno v. Medina et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER and WRIT of HABEAS CORPUS AD TESTIFICANDUM ISSUED signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 2/14/14 ORDERING the Custodian to produce Mark Anthony Moreno via video conferencing at California State Prison, Sacramento on March 19, 2014 from 11:00-11:30 before Judge Edmund F. Brennan. Custodian is ordered to notify the Court of any changes in custody and to provide new custodian with a copy of this writ. Clerk shall serve a copy of this order and writ on the Custodian. (cc: IT Dept)(Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Moreno v. Medina et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 3/21/14 ORDERING that Defendant Medinas motion to modify the scheduling order to extend the time within which he may file a fourth motion for summary judgment (ECF Nos. 121, 122) is granted. Medinas summary judgment motion shall be filed no later than April 2, 2014. Plaintiffs response to Medinas motion shall be filed no later than May 5, 2014. Defense counsel shall show cause, within 14 days, why monetary sanctions should not be imposed for his (or his predecessors) failure to comply with this courts scheduling order and Rule 16 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.(Dillon, M)

Lawrence Bragg and/or the California Office of the Attorney General shall pay the Clerk of Court $500 in monetary sanctions for their failure to comply with Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 16 and the courts scheduling order. (Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Moreno v. Medina et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 8/5/14 ORDERING that plaintiffs requests for a court order compelling prison officials to allow him to review and copy his central file and medical records 138 and 139 are DENIED without prejudice; and Plaintiffs request for an extension of time is granted and plaintiff has 21 days from the date of this order to file his opposition to the currently-pending motion for summary judgment. (Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Moreno v. Medina et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 12/03/14 ordering that within 14 days from the date of this order, plaintiff shall file an opposition to the motion or statement of no opposition. Given the lengthy extensions of time previously granted, the court is not inclined to grant further extensions. (Plummer, M)
